events.name: Stephen Marley at The Roxy Theatre
events.description: A Jamaican-American musician and is the son of Bob Marley. Marley is an eight-time Grammy Award winner, three times as a solo artist, twice as a producer of younger brother Damian Marley's Halfway Tree and Welcome to Jamrock albums, and a further three times as a member of his older brother Ziggy Marley's group Ziggy Marley & The Melody Makers.

events.name: Dread Mar at The Hollywood Bowl
events.address: 2301 N Highland Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90068
events.description: Dread Mar-I is a charting, best-selling Argentine reggae singer, songwriter, and bandleader. His sensual, passionate vocal delivery ranges over a style that combines deep roots reggae with the sweetness of lovers rock. Dread was born Mariano Javier Castro in Quequ√©n, Argentina in January of 1978.

events.name: Chronixx at The El Rey Theatre
events.description: Jamar Rolando McNaughton, popularly known as Chronixx, is a Jamaican reggae artist. His stage name replaced the name Little Chronicle which he was given because of his father, the singer Chronicle.

events.name: Earl Sweatshirt at The Roxy Theatre
events.description: AThebe Neruda Kgositsile, also known by his stage name Earl Sweatshirt, is an American rapper, songwriter, and record producer.

events.name: Stephen Marley at The Greek Theatre
events.address: 2700 N Vermont Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90027
events.description: Durk Derrick Banks (born October 19, 1992), known professionally as Lil Durk, is an American rapper and singer from Chicago, Illinois.[6] He is the lead member and founder of the collective and record label, Only the Family (OTF).

events.name: Lil baby at The Wiltern Theatre
events.description: Dominique Armani Jones, known professionally as Lil Baby, is an American rapper. He rose to mainstream fame in 2017 following the release of his mixtape Perfect Timing.
